page.title: 15CHICKERELL LIBRARY
page.content: {CHICKERELL LIBRARY}BELONGS TO THE PEOPLE OF{CHICKERELL}.IT WAS DONATED TO THE VILLAGE BY{SIR HENRY PETO}.FOR ITS SIZE, IT IS ONE OF THE MOST USED {LIBRARIES}IN{DORSET}.IT IS RUN BY{ {DORSET COUNTY COUNCIL}AND GETS ALL ITS BOOKS FROM{DORCHESTER}.IT HOLDS ABOUT 4,000 BOOKS AND THERE HAVE BEEN 25,010 ISSUES IN 1985.THE{NON-FICTION}BOOKS ARE MOST COMMONLY READ.THE BOOKS IN THE{LIBRARY}RANGE FROM JUNIOR{FICTION} TO ADULT{NON- FICTION}.THE NUMBER OF READERS THIS YEAR IS 947 THAT IS 597 AND 350 CHILDREN.IT HAS BOOKS WITH LARGE PRINT FOR PEOPLE WITH POOR EYESIGHT. THE{LIBRARY}IS NOT JUST USED AS A{ {LIBRARY}.CHILDREN GO THERE TO DO THEIR HOME-WORK.THE{LIBRARY}ALSO KEEPS PAMPHLETS ON GARDENS IN{DORSET}AND HOLIDAY BROCHURES WITH INFORMATION ON FETES AND FAIRS.
